info.title: Flight Most Traveled Destinations
info.description:
# Introduction

The Flight Most Traveled Destinations REST/JSON API provides a list of the most popular flight destinations from a given origin during a specific period.

This can help answer questions like "Where are most people flying to from Paris during the month of September?"

The response is a list of air-traffic objects with the following information:
- destination city
- flights score: ratio betwewen the number of flights to the destination from that origin and the total number of flights from that origin (int between 0 and 100, 100 being the score for the top destination)
- travelers score: ratio betwewen the number of passengers traveling to the destination from that origin and the total number of passengers traveling from that origin (int between 0 and 100, 100 being the score for the top destination) 
The list is ordered by travelers scores by default, meaningthat the destination with the highest number of travelers is at the top of the list. Sorting by flights score is also possible.

# Limitations

The traffic summary data is limited to bookings done through travel agencies (online and offline) using Amadeus.

# Authorization

Before using the API you will need to get an access token. Please read our **[Authorization Guide](https://developers.amadeus.com/self-service/apis-docs/guides/authorization)** for more information on how to get your token.

# Supported Operations

Resource: air-traffic

HTTP Method: GET

1.1.0: Naming of parameter origin changed for originCityCode
1.0.2: AFD-743 - add subtype in the reply

get.summary: Returns a list of air traffic reports.

parameters.name: originCityCode
parameters.description: Code for the origin city following IATA standard ([IATA table codes](http://www.iata.org/publications/Pages/code-search.aspx)). - e.g. BOS for Boston

parameters.name: period
parameters.description:
period when consumers are traveling.
* It can be a month only. 
* [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format must be used - e.g. 2015-05. 
* Period ranges are not supported. 
* Only periods from 2011-01 up to previous month are valid. 
* Future dates are not supported.

parameters.name: max
parameters.description: maximum number of destinations in the response. Default value is **10** and maximum value is 50.

destination.description: IATA code of the destination city - [IATA table codes](http://www.iata.org/publications/Pages/code-search.aspx)

status.description: the HTTP status code applicable to this error

title.description: a short summary of the error

source.title: Issue_Source
source.description: an object containing references to the source of the error

pointer.description: a JSON Pointer [RFC6901] to the associated entity in the request document

parameter.description: a string indicating which URI query parameter caused the issue

example.description: a string indicating an example of the right value

score.description: Approximate score for ranking purposes calculated based on number of flights from / to the airport or city
Approximate score for ranking purposes calculated based on number of travelers in the location.

pageOffset.name: page[offset]
pageOffset.description: start index of the requested page

sort.name: sort
sort.description:
defines on which attribute the sorting will be done:
* analytics.flights.score - sort destination by flights score (decreasing)
* **analytics.travelers.score** - sort destination by traveler's score (decreasing)

fields.name: fields
fields.description:
list of attributes desired in the response or list of attributes to remove from the response (with "-" before fields) 
* The attributes names must contain the whole path (except resource name) e.g. travelers

400.description:
code    | title                                 
------- | ------------------------------------- 
477     | INVALID FORMAT
572     | INVALID OPTION
2781    | INVALID LENGTH
4926    | INVALID DATA RECEIVED                               
32171   | MANDATORY DATA MISSING
